Description: Cleopatra and Octavian; the Queen of Egypt stands on the right, her servants huddled behind her while their mistress pleads with Octavian, who stands on the left, followed by two soldiers; a bust of Caesar stands between them; copy in reverse and reduced in size of an illustration originally executed for Charles Rollin's 'The Ancient History of the Egyptians, Carthaginians, Assyrians, Babylonians, Medes, and Persians' (first published in London: Knapton, 1738-1740); proof before lettering Etching and engraving
Curator's comments: Copy in reverse and reduced in size of a plate engraved by Le Bas after Gravelot; see 1857,0217.141.
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (not described) (Gravelot)
Associated titles: The Ancient History of the Egyptians, Carthaginians, Assyrians, Babylonians, Medes, and Persians
